topdown

Class Bullet

  • java.lang.Object
    • topdown.GameObject
      • topdown.Bullet

  • public class Bullet
extends GameObject
    Class used to create bullets within the Game.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Isaac Jimenez, Nicholas English, Suman Gurung

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double distance
      represents how far the bullet should travel.
      private Handler handle
      Holds the handler object for the enemy object.
      private int height
      represents the height of the bullet.
      private double speed
      represents how fast the bullet will travel.
      private int width
      Represents the length of the bullet.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Bullet(int x, int y, Type type, Handler handle, int xSpd, int ySpd)
      Constructor accepts in multiple parameters and uses them to call super and the calculateVelocity method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void calculateVelocity(int fromX, int fromY, int toX, int toY)
      Determines the velocity of the bullet depending on where it is shot from and towards what point.
      java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
      Returns the boundaries of the bullet as a rectangle.
      void playShot()
      Plays a shooting sound for the current bullet.
      void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Updates the image of the bullet as it travels across the screen.
      void tick()
      Updates the current position of the bullet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bullet

        public Bullet(int x,
              int y,
              Type type,
              Handler handle,
              int xSpd,
              int ySpd)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor accepts in multiple parameters and uses them to call super and the calculateVelocity method.
        Parameters:
        x - represents the x coordinate at which it will spawn.
        y - represents the y coordinate at which it will spawn.
        type - represents the type of object.
        handle - represents the instance of Handler class being. used
        xSpd - represents the speed at which the bullet travels horizontally.
        ySpd - represents the speed at which the bullet travels vertically.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the input operation fails.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateVelocity

        public void calculateVelocity(int fromX,
                              int fromY,
                              int toX,
                              int toY)
        Determines the velocity of the bullet depending on where it is shot from and towards what point.
        Parameters:
        fromX - Holds an int that represents the X-coordinate of the bullet's origin.
        fromY - Holds an int that represents the Y-coordinate of the bullet's origin.
        toX - Holds an int that represents the X-coordinate of the bullet's destination.
        toY - Holds an int that represents the Y-coordinate of the bullet's destination.

      • playShot

        public void playShot()
        Plays a shooting sound for the current bullet.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Updates the current position of the bullet.
        Specified by:
        tick in class GameObject

      • render

        public void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Updates the image of the bullet as it travels across the screen.
        Specified by:
        render in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        g - represents the instance of the Graphics class used.

      • getBounds

        public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
        Returns the boundaries of the bullet as a rectangle.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the boundaries of the bullet as a rectangle.
